infotexts.entitydescription.touhousprayer: A special sprayer used to fire Touhou decals.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodpackB: Not much different from an ordinary blood bag, except it tastes far better to vampires.
infotexts.entitydescription.remiliapaint: A can of Remilia-themed sticker paint for the Touhou Sprayer.\n‖color:255,36,0,255‖Remilia lives in the Scarlet Devil Mansion, a red manor on the lake in Gensokyo. She is the young mistress of that house.\n— *Imperishable Night*‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Gungnier_Spear: An afterimage of Gungnir, yet still Gungnir’s afterimage. Ammunition for the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Harpoon Gun | Remilia Scarlet‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.youmupaint: A can of Youmu-themed sticker paint for the Touhou Sprayer.\n‖color:156,158,161,255‖A cosmos flower is tied to Youmu’s scabbard. The Roukanken is said to cut down ten spirits in a single swing and can sever nearly anything.\n— *Perfect Cherry Blossom*‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Youmu_Smgmagazine: ‖color:156,158,161,255‖Bullets from the Netherworld that can pierce most armor on Europa; usable in SMG-type weapons.‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.youmuceremonialsword: ‖color:156,158,161,255‖A youkai-forged blade too long for ordinary humans. Said to strike down ten spirits with a single swing and cut almost anything.\n— *Perfect Memento in Strict Sense*‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.youmuwatermelon: The latest achievement of Europa hydroponics. Unfortunately it only fills the stomach and cannot heal wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Koishi_Knife: At first glance, it's just a regular kitchen knife, but it's Koishi's personal weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.Aya_News: ‖color:255,255,255,255‖Perfect for a boring afternoon with tea in hand. Can be sold at a good price, or handed to a friend to turn into a more valuable manuscript.‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Aya_Circular_Fan: A maple leaf-shaped fan, quite popular among the tengu. Requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Maple Leaves‖end‖ to use.
infotexts.entitydescription.Aya_Maple_Leaves: Fans are tools for creating wind: one swipe can knock down a house, two can topple a tree, and three can blow away a traveler’s cloak. Used as ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Aya’s Maple Fan‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Reimu_Paint: A can of Reimu-themed paint, used in Touhou Sprayers.\n‖color:255,81,75,255‖When visiting the shrine, you don’t need money — just bring food or sake. Maybe that’s why the offering box is always empty…‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Power_Point: Overflowing with power. Can be used at the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Altar‖end‖ to craft powerful equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.Score_Point: Does this icon feel a little... off?
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Material: A mystical substance synthesized from alien materials, said to be named after an album. An important ingredient at the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Altar‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Mc_SnowBall: Sudden art style shift. Used as ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Icicle‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Spiritual_Water: Water gathered from alien sources, faintly infused with spiritual energy. Can be collected directly underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.Remilia_Doll: Full of dignity! (Load Remilia Paint into it and carry to slowly heal injuries. Right-click while held to double the effect.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Maoyu_Duffel_Bag: The soft outer shell left after a Keystar's spirit departs.\nThis might be why they’re so hard to eliminate — unless you deal with the source, they’ll just keep regenerating and drifting through the shipping lanes.
infotexts.entitydescription.Plant_Essential_Oil: Extracted from plants using the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Altar‖end‖. Used in alchemy rituals and healing common injuries.
infotexts.entitydescription.Europa_Infusion: A complex infusion crafted using the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Altar‖end‖. Highly magical.\nCan treat most injuries and enhance the body. Recipe is said to originate from a place called Eientei…
infotexts.entitydescription.Gilead_Branch_Seed: A mysterious plant growing on Europa. Might be the byproduct of a failed lab experiment...
infotexts.entitydescription.Gilead_Branch: A naturally shed branch from the Gilead tree. Has medicinal value. Can be refined at the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Altar‖end‖. Represents the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Wood Element‖end‖ in alchemy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Balm_Of_Gilead: A magical balm made from Gilead Branch and essential oil. Has strong healing power — but be careful with timing, misuse may be fatal…
infotexts.entitydescription.Cinnamon_Incense: A stick of unknown-origin incense, occasionally sold on the market. Soothing when burned… though some say this is a poor use of it.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peach: A peach of unknown origin. Looks sweet and tempting — who knows what happens if you eat it?
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hakkero: A small octagonal furnace with a hole in the center and a bagua symbol on the front. Power source unknown. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Star Danmaku, Stardust Reverie, or Star Bottles‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hakkero_Ammo01: A simple star-shaped container used to fire plain star danmaku. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mini Hakkero‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hakkero_Ammo02: At a glance, it’s just a recolored version of standard Star Danmaku… Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mini Hakkero‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Fake_Hakkero: A crude imitation of the Mini Hakkero — but still, it imitates the Mini Hakkero.
infotexts.entitydescription.Homing_Amulet: A stack of amulets that seem to contain mysterious power.
infotexts.entitydescription.Freeze_Icicle_Fall: A large, puzzling chunk of ice — is that a frog inside? (Activate by inserting Snowballs, restore energy by soaking in water.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Blunderbuss: A relic from the Moon — a highly unstable gun that might hurt its wielder. Charge to use. consumes ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mind Tremor, Lunatic Eye, Mind Star Mine, Lunatic Blass or rifleammo‖end‖)
infotexts.entitydescription.Mind_Bullet: A replica of a Moon relic. Incredibly powerful. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Blunderbuss / Mercy‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Lunatic_Bullet: A replica of a terrifying Moon relic. Holds immense destructive power. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Blunderbuss / Mercy‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Gungnier: A mysterious weapon from a distant land, brimming with devastating power. ‖color:gui.orange‖(Beware of friendly fire)‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Mokou_Flamer: A practical ignition tool, adapted to even light fires in Europa’s frozen environment.
infotexts.entitydescription.Phoenix_Tail: A mass-produced version of the phoenix tail. Cheap. Recently rated by the immortal community as more convenient than searching for the Hourai Elixir. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mokou’s Oxidizer‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Hisou_Sword: Capable of striking at an opponent’s weak point with precision. Only a Celestial can wield it properly.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sakuya_Knife_Ir: A light weapon, easy to carry and throwable.
infotexts.entitydescription.youmuceremonialsword2: A sword forged by youkai to sever confusion. Only those of the Konpaku family can use it.
infotexts.entityname.Thousand_Needle_Ammo: ‖color:255,36,0,255‖Hell Sign “Needle Mountain of a Thousand Needles”‖color:end‖ (Autocannon)
infotexts.entitydescription.Thousand_Needle_Ammo: Those who break promises must swallow a thousand needles. (Used as autocannon ammo)
infotexts.entitydescription.Phoenix_Wings_Ammo: It is said the immortal phoenix rises from its own flames. (Used as pulse laser ammo)
infotexts.entitydescription.Milky_Way_Ammo: A magical galaxy.\nThe star sand glitters with vibrant colors. (Used as Coilgun ammo)
infotexts.entitydescription.Yin_Yang_Spirit_Orb: A spell card that hurls a massive yin-yang orb from who-knows-where. (Used as railgun ammo)
infotexts.entitydescription.Marisa_Broom: A standard magician’s broom. Power source unknown, but somehow it can fly — even without a broom.
infotexts.entitydescription.Power_Bank: A mysterious power bank seemingly powered by magic. Can recharge most batteries.
infotexts.entitydescription.Nitori_Backpack: A standard kappa work backpack. Carries many items and provides oxygen — but ‖color:gui.yellow‖can’t withstand water pressure‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Kappa_Backpack_Plus: An upgraded kappa backpack. Though capacity remains the same, its enhanced spiritual energy grants protection — even against ‖color:gui.orange‖4000 meters‖color:end‖ of pressure.
infotexts.entitydescription.Kappa_Miningdrill: A mining tool favored by kappas — portable, easy to use, durable, and above all… cheap. Has 5 extra ore storage slots. Powered by ‖color:gui.yellow‖Spiritual Water or batteries‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Illness_Recovery_Charm: The Moriya Shrine amulet that can heal injuries when the wearer is sober (occupies the ear slot)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Base_Metal: The second-stage magical metal, used in synthesizing base materials. Surprisingly widespread in Europa's military tech.
infotexts.entitydescription.Mu_Alchemical: A purified bottle of the Wood Element — a high-quality alchemical product.
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Altar: A ritual table for occult crafting. Used for synthesizing key items. ‖color:gui.yellow‖(Right-click + E to place, press E to pick up)‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Alchemy_Table: A table designed for alchemy, capable of handling many complex operations. ‖color:gui.yellow‖(Right-click + E to place, press E to pick up)‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Elements_Book: A grimoire that records the secrets of elemental conversion and fusion. It lets you rapidly switch elemental energies to adapt to different situations, but only a mage seasoned by years of practice can unleash its full power. \n(Element generation requires placing a Philosopher’s Stone or an Imitation Philosopher’s Stone. Note that generating an element removes any existing contents!)
infotexts.entitydescription.Kanameishi_Cannon: In Gensokyo, whether planting or uprooting a keystone, only the Naito (Hinai) lineage can do so. (Used as Cannon shells.)
infotexts.entityname.Immortal_Moon_Smoke: ‖color:255,72,36,255‖Ascend to the Moon, Smoke of the Undying‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Immortal_Moon_Smoke: Ascend to the Moon, Smoke of the Undying.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Spell_Book: A book that records all manner of curious magic. Careful study yields a wealth of arcane knowledge.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Budesonide: A medicine that can relieve asthma symptoms. When used properly, it has no side effects.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_MEID: A temporary body-enhancement agent that grants long-lasting physical reinforcement and increases skill levels after injection. Patchouli developed it to adapt her body to Europa’s environment, and it’s now sold in major pharmacies. \nAccording to users, it feels like being controlled as a marionette, as if the body weren’t their own. \n“This is not a negative description,” one user added.
infotexts.entitydescription.Cinnamon_Branch: A mysterious plant product that appeared on Europa at some point. It’s popular for its distinctive composition and pleasant scent.
infotexts.entitydescription.Cinnamon_Branch_Seed: A mysterious plant that appeared on Europa. Due to low yield and difficulty of acquisition, it’s hotly pursued by various factions.
infotexts.entitydescription.Hyouibana_Dream: Upon use, lets another character possess you, granting their talent and some abilities. Use a second time to become fully possessed and gain maximum enhancement. Full possession is removed upon death, but regular possession remains.
infotexts.entitydescription.Huo_Alchemical: A bottle of refined Fire Element—an excellent alchemical product.
infotexts.entitydescription.Tu_Alchemical: A bottle of refined Earth Element—an excellent alchemical product.
infotexts.entitydescription.Jin_Alchemical: A bottle of refined Metal Element—an excellent alchemical product.
infotexts.entitydescription.Shui_Alchemical: A bottle of refined Water Element—an excellent alchemical product.
infotexts.entitydescription.Yang_Alchemical: Shake the bottle—the contents resemble a tiny sun.
infotexts.entitydescription.Yin_Alchemical: Merely gazing at it brings a calm to the mind.
infotexts.entitydescription.Seven_Elements_Alchemi: A simply fabricated imitation of the Philosopher’s Stone, yet it can at least perform basic magical functions.

A legendary creation whose structure and principles defy Europa’s science; to Patchouli, however, it’s merely an ordinary collectible.\nIt can replenish its energy anywhere—except in the cold depths of the sea.
infotexts.entitydescription.Byproduct_Alchemical: Impurities produced during alchemy. A skilled alchemist won’t waste any usable spiritual residue.
infotexts.entitydescription.Baka_Horn: By appearances it’s no different from a clown’s horn, but the sound it makes is quite unique.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Royal_Flare: Scorching sunlight pierces the chill of January. (Used as Pulse Laser ammo.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Silent_Selene_A: Silent moonlight gazes upon every broken night. (Used as Coilgun ammo.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Byproduct_Alchemical: A byproduct of alchemical refinement. Slightly toxic; can be used for transmutation and medicines.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Reiki_Stability: A direct-acting remedy for disordered spiritual energy; somewhat habit-forming.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Foul_Potion: A poison brewed from alchemical byproducts.\nAs with life and death, alchemical transmutation yields copious impurities.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Apple: Good thing it’s on time—it hasn’t turned into “Bad Apple!!”
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tenshi_Peach: A peach plucked… from a hat?
infotexts.entitydescription.Origin_Deafult01: Unchanging Worldly Pessimism ~ Shinkirou Festival Tune
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hakkero_Star_Bo: Starlight gathered over a long time is highly compressed within; it can no longer fire danmaku and is only suitable for large-scale starlight magic. Requires a very long time to accumulate starlight. Ammunition for the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mini Hakkero‖end‖.\n“It’s not easy to collect stars under the sea!”
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Spell_Tutorial: An introductory magic primer suitable for beginners.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Beer: A drink rarely seen on Europa—said to have been someone’s inseparable ‘best friend.’
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Winchester: An ancient Earth firearm upgraded by the kappa for better performance. Compatible with various shot shells, but unsafe for the unskilled—the user can be harmed. \n\nExorcising youkai…
infotexts.entitydescription.Exorcism_Bullet: Buckshot made from substances feared by the wicked—deals greater damage to non-humans. Ammunition for the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Exorcist’s Holy Flame‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Fire_Element_Book: A disposable grimoire with built-in mana that even novices can use with ease.
infotexts.entitydescription.Water_Element_Book: A disposable grimoire with built-in mana that even novices can use with ease.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Concentrated_En: The kappa built this at Tenshi’s request. Though it falls short of an ideal “keystone,” its convenient keystone-launching function pleases her. Often injures the user underwater… ‖color:gui.orange‖(Beware of friendly fire.)‖color:end‖ Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Electric Keystone‖end‖.

A keystone energized by lightning during special weather—serves as the power module for the arc emitter.\n“By rights, shouldn’t a keystone be an insulator…?” Ammunition for the ‖color:gui.yellow‖Concentrated Energy Arc Emitter — Handheld‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Patchouli_Doll: Mu~Q! (Insert any bottled element, carry to slowly regenerate health. Right-click while held to double the effect.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Baka_grenade: Anyone caught in the blast is an idiot!
infotexts.entitydescription.Yuka_Parasol: A parasol scented with flowers—its owner must be an avid gardener.
infotexts.entitydescription.Flandre_Doll: Hold right-click to use and randomly unlock one of Flandre’s three additional talents.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Thunder_Drum_Bo: Elegance of the sky? It’s a storm if you ask me. (Used as Pulse Laser ammo.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Fantasy_Wind: To fly freely through the air—how dashing. (Used as Chaingun ammo.)
infotexts.entityname.Celestial_Decay: Heavenly Sword “Five Decays of the Celestial Being” (Chaingun)
infotexts.entitydescription.Celestial_Decay: A supposed omen that heralds a celestial’s death. (Used as Chaingun ammo.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Tengu_Longsword: A longsword used by tengu—light yet powerful.
infotexts.entitydescription.Tengu_Shield: A small guard shield used by tengu. It blocks most danmaku and is widely used due to its portability.
infotexts.entitydescription.Tengu_Shield_Huge: A large guard shield used by tengu. It can resist enemy attacks, but its weight and size severely reduce the user’s danmaku fire rate and hinder swordplay.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rippling: Said to be a weapon forged by Miko using special spirit orbs found on Europa, though this one is clearly a variant adapted for Europa and lacks her style. Insert a ‖color:gui.yellow‖Spirit Orb‖end‖ to fire special danmaku.

Override.loading: Now loading… a maiden is praying…

infotexts.loadingscreentip: Compared to starting from scratch at the Ritual Altar, purchasing materials or playing bullet-hell minigames can stock up Izanagi Substance faster.
Compared to starting from scratch at the Ritual Altar, purchasing materials or playing bullet-hell minigames can stock up Izanagi Substance faster.
Astral-Tier Metal is especially expensive, but its alchemical efficiency is high.
Astral-Tier Metal is especially expensive, but its alchemical efficiency is high.
Aether-Tier Metal is closely tied to mages and is one of the most important materials.
Aether-Tier Metal is closely tied to mages and is one of the most important materials.
Most special items must be synthesized at the Ritual Altar, so it’s crucial for a mage to carry one.
Most special items must be synthesized at the Ritual Altar, so it’s crucial for a mage to carry one.
infotexts.entitydescription.Symposium_Of_Post_Myst: Wisdom, benevolence, and courage are esteemed virtues—let them gather here.
infotexts.entitydescription.Perfect_Memento_In_Str: A closed world with no humans to record history. Youkai cannot recall the past precisely, and truth is scarce in Gensokyo. Without understanding youkai, humans can only fear them. If you can learn their abilities and countermeasures, avoid danger, and recognize those adept at subduing youkai, perhaps you won’t have to live in constant dread.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Europa_Customs: Even quiet text undergoes tremendous change.
infotexts.entitydescription.Aya_Press_Card: Proof of Aya’s status as a reporter. Use at an outpost to call Akyuu or other contractors.
infotexts.entitydescription.Scarlet_Devil_Mansion: Red spiritual energy burns like fire—though it may not actually be flame. (Used as Chaingun ammo.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Precious_Metal: A highly valuable magical metal—third-stage alchemical output. Compared with Aether-Tier Metal, it has better elemental conversion efficiency and is used for more important synthesis.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Potion_Pu: A magical potion that purifies alien infection within the body—rapidly kills xenolife like “skinwalkers,” including symbionts.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cyber_Homing_Am: A fusion of magic and technology. This rechargeable energy ofuda is more powerful but sacrifices some fire rate. ‖color:gui.orange‖(Beware of friendly fire.)‖color:end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Pouch: A belt crafted from magical materials and beloved by mages. Paired with a mana shawl, it can raise the user’s mana to the maximum. Includes three vial slots for different element bottles to provide varied healing effects.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Aya_Camera: A classic camera requiring full manual operation. Unlike Aya’s previous model, it compels the subject to pose rather than erasing danmaku. Its only flaw is the short immobilization time on large foes. Consumes ‖color:gui.yellow‖Film‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Aya_Maple_Film: An old-fashioned film whose exquisite craft still captures crucial images on Europa. Magical materials grant it the extra effect of freezing enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.Sun_Flower_Seed: Sunflowers obviously can’t be grown on Europa—or so most think. (Recommend planting in a magical-material planter.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Sun_Flower_Petal01: A petal with razor edges—handle with care. (Use in the medical interface.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Sun_Flower_Petal02: Almost weightless; a breeze makes it vanish. (Use in the medical interface.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Sun_Flower_Petal03: A petal that seems alive—you can feel a faint vibration when pinched. (Use in the medical interface.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Crimson_Moonlig: ‖color:255,36,0,255‖“And then… was there no one left?”‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Potion_Ca: A magic potion formulated for direct drinking, with added curative components. The sweeteners make it popular among children.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Laevatein: The entire sword burns endlessly, shining brighter than the sun. Its size is so immense that even a vampire cannot swing it swiftly.\nEach strike Flandre delivers with Laevatein inflicts damage equal to a small portion of the target’s maximum health—“Eye of Destruction.” When the Eye of Destruction reaches 100%, death is inevitable.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mysterious_Pear: A mysterious pearl that radiates an enigmatic aura. Approaching it enhances mystical power; if you look closely, it seems as though a lake lies within, with a head resembling a brontosaurus rising from the center. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Rippling‖end‖.\n‖color:gui.yellow‖Holding the pearl unlocks specific talents.‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Eternal_Night_B: A bow modeled after Eirin’s design, its power depends largely on the arrows used. Unfortunately, an imitation is still just an imitation. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Arrow-type‖end‖ ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Metal_Arr: A basic magic arrow forged from magical metal that effectively hinders a target’s movement. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Eternal Night / Three-Fairy Triple Ballista‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Starbow_Break: A rare encounter—consider yourself lucky to meet this one. (Used as fragmentation cannon ammunition.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mysterious_Pear: ‖color:gui.yellow‖Hold to receive mission completion proof.‖end‖‖color:gui.red‖Mission item only (must be stored in a creation transport crate).‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Salvage_Mysterious_Pea: Contains important data—possibly a key clue in investigating the anomaly. Deliver it to Akyuu at the outpost; she may know something.
infotexts.entityname.Touhou_Missions_Collection_Nu: Akyuu’s Mission Log – Mysterious Ripples and the Long Night
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Missions_Collec: This log records valuable data that can help you recall previous battles.
Can be combined with other logs at the Ritual Altar to create the Complete Log. Allows acceptance of all currently known missions (cannot be challenged again on Story difficulty).
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Aya_Token: Right-click to greatly enhance physical abilities. Effective only for tengu.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Penglai_Jade_Br: Legend says the true Penglai Jade Branch comes from Mount Penglai in the Eastern Sea, with silver for branches, gold for stems, and fruit of jade. Whether this one is genuine is unknown. A hidden notch allows insertion of the Brilliant Dragon Pearl to activate its danmaku-firing ability. ‖color:gui.orange‖Beware of friendly fire.‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Brilliant_Drago: A gem radiating magical power, seemingly linked to the Penglai Jade Branch. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Penglai Jade Branch‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Blue_Rose: A unique revolver with two parallel barrels. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Hand Cannon Rounds‖end‖ or ‖color:gui.yellow‖Color Up Rounds‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Color_Up_Bullet: An exceptionally special high-explosive round capable of stunning small enemies. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Azure Rose – Custom‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Apple: Candy loved by fairies; can also be used as a synthesis ingredient.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Peach: Candy loved by fairies; can also be used as a synthesis ingredient.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Lemon: Candy loved by fairies; can also be used as a synthesis ingredient.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Pomelo: Candy loved by fairies; can also be used as a synthesis ingredient.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mutation_Candy: Use in the health interface to amplify mutation energy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Super_Candy: A special candy with impressive healing effects, blending four flavors.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Cannon: A handheld cannon that fires sugar-coated shells—don’t be fooled by its sweet talk.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sugar_Coated_Ca: Sweet in taste, but the danger within is undeniable. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Candy Cannon / Candy Cannon Plus‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Huge_Sugar_Coat: Bigger, more, stronger. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Candy Cannon / Candy Cannon Plus‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Pouch: A portable pouch designed specifically for storing candy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Frozen_Frog: An icy block encasing a frog. Insert ‖color:gui.yellow‖Perfect Snowflake‖end‖ to activate its danmaku ability.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Perfect_Snowfla: A perfectly shaped hexagonal snowflake imbued with pure cold. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Frozen Frog‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Pouch_Medical_Ex: A modified version of the Element Belt that sacrifices magical defense for greater medical storage capacity without altering its magical nature.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Candy_Essence: Fairies gain additional talents upon use, up to five.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Elixir_Of_Pengl: A miraculous medicine that can resurrect the dead and instantly heal wounds. (After revival, the player will be unable to control the character—use with caution.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Kappa_Welding_T: A high-efficiency repair tool compatible with welding fuel tanks and combustant tanks, or dedicated ‖color:gui.orange‖Solidifying Foam Canisters‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Kappa Energy Fuel‖end‖. Can also mount nuclear energy capacitor magazines and other weapon attachments. Highly recommended.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Nuclear_Battery: Usable with the Kappa Welding Tool to emit repair beams for remote hull repairs.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fix_Foamg_Tank: Highly compressed solidifying foam dedicated to hull repair with the Kappa Welding Tool. Extremely durable and increases repair speed by about 35%.\n—“External tools are fine, but never forget to hone your own skills.”
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Nuclear_Energy_: A technological product of Kappa Heavy Industries, a cutting-edge fusion-tech crystal capable of firing searing lasers that easily melt obstacles. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Kappa Welding Tool‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Kappa_Multi_Fun: A simple repair tool finely improved by kappas, capable of repairing both mechanical and electrical equipment. Skilled hands can achieve greatly enhanced efficiency.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hellfire_Torch: A torch rekindled with hellfire; its unstable energy can disturb the bearer’s mind. Only fairies of hell can fully attune to its magic.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Love_Maze: A bow-shaped weapon formed entirely of fire magic, firing scorching danmaku. Deals greater damage to enemies with lower health. After three normal shots, the next shot temporarily becomes a triple burst.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Simple_Parts: Parts salvaged from discarded equipment, useful for crafting certain tools.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Precision_Parts: Reusable materials recovered from neglected corners.
infotexts.entitydescription.Nitori_Backpack_Tactic: A Kappa backpack improved for combat environments, sacrificing some capacity and performance for greater strategic value. Contains a special slot for Kappa Energy Fuel to provide oxygen and movement speed boosts, or for a Nuclear Energy Capacitor Magazine to add combat capability. Withstands water pressure of ‖color:gui.orange‖4200 m‖color:end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Friendship_Juic: Grants a “Friendship” effect for ten minutes after drinking, reducing friendly fire damage by 20%.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Koishi_Knife: At first glance, it's just an ordinary knife — but it's Koishi's personal weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Strange_Phone: A telephone with only a receiver; eerie sounds occasionally emanate from within. Speaking into it affects nearby hostile creatures, inflicting the “Philosophy of the Despised” effect, which increases damage taken—especially from Koishi.
infotexts.entitydescription.Iron_Element_Book: A single-use grimoire infused with magic, allowing even beginners to cast spells with ease.
infotexts.entitydescription.Earth_Element_Book: A single-use grimoire infused with magic, allowing even beginners to cast spells with ease.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pendulum_Neckla: A necklace made of crystal imbued with abundant magic, slightly increasing the wearer’s magical power. When magic ability exceeds 80, it removes Patchouli’s running restriction. Occupies the headset slot.
infotexts.entitydescription.Youmu_Smgmagazine_Plus: An upgraded Nether magazine with greater penetration and sharper projectiles. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖SMG | Youmu Konpaku‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scorching_Ray_G: A weapon crafted by kappas, modeled after Fujiwara no Mokou’s flames, containing searing energy no one can ignore. Uses Scorching Core ammunition; inserting a fuel rod enhances performance.
Specially forged to contain the phoenix’s flame, this core serves as ammunition for the Scorching Ray Gun. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Scorching Ray Gun‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Alice_Needle: Ordinarily, needles for sewing dolls are tiny—clearly this one was not meant for doll-making.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Alice_Doll_Hand: Alice's handheld bag, can store notes, keeping them away from Europa's frigid waters. Also increases doll energy recovery rate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Alice_Doll_Purs: Alice's purse for storing tools, still waterproof and fireproof. Also increases doll energy recovery rate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Alice_Doll_Suit: Alice's suitcase for holding dolls, can protect the dolls inside from Europa's frigid waters. Also increases doll energy recovery rate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Berry_Wine: A specialty wine inspired by the youkai after arriving on Europa. Restores blood and helps detoxify, but ordinary humans may find it overpowering.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Life_Needle: Used to harvest fear from the corpses of hostile nonhuman entities, though it appears as a harmless pointer.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fear_Item: The residual fear of a deceased individual. Must be collected using a Needle of Life.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tide: Tides rise and fall, gatherings and partings.\nInsert into ‖color:gui.yellow‖Miniature Earth–Moon System‖end‖ to activate its danmaku ability.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Miniature_Earth: A delicate miniature of the Earth–Moon system, though its creator seems to have forgotten Earth’s true appearance. Dedicated ammunition for Tide. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Tide‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scarlet_Gensoky: The crimson of high speed—no tricks, only raw power.\nActivating High-Speed Mode greatly increases potency but inflicts some damage on the user.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunarquake: A mysterious weapon created by kappas on Europa using the unique motions of nearby celestial bodies. Its firing rate gradually increases the longer it is used.\nFires using ‖color:gui.yellow‖Lunarquake Core‖end‖ ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Center: “Have you heard? There are earthquakes on the Moon too.”\nAmmunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Lunarquake‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.gensokyo_divinggear: A miraculous aura that shields the body from water pressure damage. Contains four magatama slots; durability decreases when struck.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Boudary_Divingg: A mysterious suit brought back from the edge of the boundary, resistant to 6000 m of water pressure. Contains three magatama slots; durability decreases when struck.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Ether_Divinggear: Designed with ideas from freshwater mermaids and refined by Patchouli, this suit withstands 4800 m of pressure. Contains two magatama slots; durability decreases when struck.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Veil: A protective veil designed by Patchouli to guard against magical harm, created because she disliked the breathing environment inside diving suits. Withstands 8000 m of water pressure and enhances the wearer’s magical affinity, but offers little physical defense and makes it difficult to approach electronics or machinery. Contains six magatama slots; durability decreases when struck.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Magic_Veil02: A protective veil designed by Patchouli to guard against magical harm, created because she disliked the breathing environment inside diving suits. Withstands 8000 m of water pressure and enhances the wearer’s magical affinity, but offers little physical defense and makes it difficult to approach electronics or machinery. Contains six magatama slots; durability decreases when struck.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peace_Hooked_Ja: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to provide stun resistance and illumination.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hard_Hooked_Jad: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to provide limb physical-damage resistance.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Soft_Hooked_Jad: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to resist bleeding and infected wounds on the head and torso.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Warm_Hooked_Jad: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to resist physical damage and burns to the head and torso.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Boiling_Hooked_: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to grant a slight boost to movement speed and attack power.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Icy_Hooked_Jade: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to provide minor healing, doubled when underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Smooth_Hooked_J: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to increase pressure resistance by 1000 m.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_White_Hooked_Ja: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to provide illumination; when equipped together with the Ancient Magatama – Black, triggers an additional effect.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Black_Hooked_Ja: Insert into a diving suit’s magatama slot to boost movement speed and provide head and torso resistance; when equipped together with the Ancient Magatama – White, triggers an additional effect.
infotexts.talentdescription.Gensokyo_Divinggear_Ta:
When wearing the Gensokyo Diving Suit: Magatama effects are ‖color:gui.yellow‖best‖end‖. Equipping both ‖color:gui.orange‖Black and White Magatama‖end‖ gives a ‖color:gui.green‖20%‖end‖ chance to reduce ‖color:gui.green‖25%‖end‖ damage on hit. 
When wearing the Boundary Diving Suit: Magatama effects are ‖color:gui.yellow‖better‖end‖. With ‖color:gui.orange‖Black and White Magatama‖end‖, each hit has a ‖color:gui.green‖15%‖end‖ chance to reduce ‖color:gui.green‖15%‖end‖ damage. 
When wearing the Ether Diving Suit: Magatama effects are ‖color:gui.yellow‖normal‖end‖. With ‖color:gui.orange‖Black and White Magatama‖end‖, each hit has a ‖color:gui.green‖15%‖end‖ chance to reduce ‖color:gui.green‖10%‖end‖ damage. 
When wearing the Magic Veil: Magatama effects are ‖color:gui.yellow‖best‖end‖. With ‖color:gui.orange‖Black and White Magatama‖end‖, each hit has a ‖color:gui.green‖15%‖end‖ chance to reduce ‖color:gui.green‖20%‖end‖ damage. 
When wearing the Two-Color Lotus Butterfly: Magatama effects are ‖color:gui.yellow‖better‖end‖. With ‖color:gui.orange‖Black and White Magatama‖end‖, each hit has a ‖color:gui.green‖10%‖end‖ chance to reduce ‖color:gui.green‖20%‖end‖ damage and a ‖color:gui.green‖30%‖end‖ chance to inflict ‖color:gui.yellow‖Dream Vanish‖end‖ on the attacker. 
When wearing any Possession Armament: Magatama effects will be rewritten. 
While using the above suits/armor, the effect of ‖color:gui.orange‖Moloch Gene‖end‖ is ‖color:gui.red‖halved‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Medical_Toolkit: A medical kit produced by Eientei, easy to use and equipped with unique tools that greatly enhance healing. Use the buttons to select which medicines and treatments to consume. \nDifferent slots accommodate different medicine types, providing various treatments: Slot 1: Medicinal Opium, Pomegranate Bomb Extract, Morphine, Fentanyl, or sets of these medicines. Slot 2: Saline, Blood Bag, or sets of these medicines. Slot 3: Bandage, Malleable Synthetic Skin, or sets of these medicines, plus Antibiotic Gel. Slot 4: Herbal Essential Oils, Europa Infusion, Balm of Gilead.
infotexts.entitydescription.Medical_Toolkit_AntiDa: Medicinal Opium set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
Pomegranate Bomb Extract set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
Morphine set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
Fentanyl set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
infotexts.entitydescription.Medical_Toolkit_AntiBl: Saline set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
Blood bag set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
infotexts.entitydescription.Medical_Toolkit_Antibl: Bandage set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
Malleable synthetic skin set, usable with the Eientei Medical Kit.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Small_Spell_Car: A compact spell card launcher capable of using Coilgun ammunition and related spell cards. Compared to a Coilgun, it offers higher firepower with a slightly slower average rate of fire.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rapidly_Spell_C: A high-rate spell card launcher that can use gatling ammunition and related spell cards. Compared to a gatling gun, it boasts greater firepower and rate of fire, but requires continuous fire to reduce spread.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Huge_Spell_Card: A large spell card launcher capable of using cannon or pulse-laser ammunition and related spell cards. Its firepower is much lower than other turrets, but its twin-barrel design compensates for the deficit.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sun_Cannon: A scorching grenade launcher crafted by kappas as payment for Sunny’s assistance. Fires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Standard Grenades or Garnet Grenades‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sun_Cannon_Ammo: A grenade infused with sunlight energy. Though less explosive than a standard grenade, its intense solar energy is overwhelming to foes. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Sun Cannon‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Orbit_Gun: A weapon forged by kappas as payment for Luna’s assistance, said to be inspired by satellites launched around Europa’s orbit. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Moonbeam Arrows‖end‖.
Ammunition forged from youkai and fairy memories of the moon, capable of firing powerful beams. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Lunar Orbit‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Brilliant_Star_: A weapon crafted by kappas as payment for Star’s assistance. Its crystal-like blade sparkles with delightful starlight, seemingly harmless yet deceptively dangerous.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Gene_Splicer: A kappa-developed gene splicer with thermal imaging capability, greatly simplifying thermal imaging use.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Diamond_Blizzar: An unusual phenomenon where splashing lake water crystallizes into ice. (Used as Coilgun ammunition.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Memory_Relation: Memories from Earth; can be analyzed at the alchemy table to unlock exclusive bleeding substances for specific characters.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sakuya_Knife_Et: A sharper throwing knife made from magical materials, more easily piercing the hides of Europa’s creatures.
infotexts.entitydescription.Spirit_Rune_Dream_Seal: At the end of its release, silence arrives. (Used as orbital cannon ammunition.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Vampire_Fang_Sw: A magical replica of the vampire fang entrusted to Remilia. From its nature, it seems less a part of Remilia and more a companion to Sakuya. When Sakuya wields both the Vampire Fang and the Illusory Moon Blade, performance improves. Possesses throwing-knife properties.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dream_Luna_Swor: A youkai weapon acquired during an incident. Though it cannot speak, Sakuya has somehow come to understand its will. When Sakuya wields both the Vampire Fang and the Illusory Moon Blade, performance improves. Possesses throwing-knife properties.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Luna_Clock: With each turn of the hands, past and present merge into a single moment, as if falling into a fold of time. Upon use, all enemies within a certain range are immobilized.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Moriya_Shrine_S: An ancient divine tool that releases the magic of the Wind Priestess with each use.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Treatment_Grena: The latest product of Kappa Heavy Industries, a grenade filled with restorative energy that releases a healing wind to aid allies upon detonation.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Quality_Upper_M: An experimental tool produced by Kappa Heavy Industries that upgrades magical weapons up to master quality.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Alice_Magic_Boo: A grimoire once owned by Alice. Consuming at least 10 doll energy allows summoning of dolls.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Energy_As: A fully automatic weapon reconstructed by Reisen after analyzing lunar relics. It can use various types of ammunition and delivers formidable power. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Lunar Energy Magazines, SMG Ammo, or Assault Rifle Ammo‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Energy_Ma: A high-energy magazine bound by magic, designed specifically for the Lunar Energy Rifle. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Lunar Energy Rifle‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Nue_Danmaku_Chi: Those struck by this danmaku perish from losing their true form. Lucky to forget yourself without a drink, isn’t it? (Used as fragmentation cannon ammunition.)
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Waterwheel_Gun: A simple water gun commissioned by Akyuu. High water pressure makes it dangerous to land creatures, and its special spiritual water keeps it effective underwater. Requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Waterwheel and Spirit Water‖end‖ to operate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Waterwheel_Gun_: The operating wheel built into the Waterwheel Gun; without it the weapon cannot function. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Waterwheel Gun‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sunflower_Field: A cane carried by Yuuka while tending her flowers on Europa. Its unique design allows it to radiate warm sunlight even beneath the icy seas. Hidden within the cane is a short blade used to discipline those who refuse to behave. Its raw power is not remarkable, but in her hands it is anything but negligible.
A cane blade of a peculiar nature. Normally concealed within the cane, it enhances the cane’s overall lethality. On occasion, it can also be drawn on its own to intimidate enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.Pollution_Magician_Clo: A mage’s robe sewn from magical fabric, clearly tainted by unclean magic.
A mage’s robe sewn from magical fabric, clearly tainted by unclean magic.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sparkfire_Shotg: This weapon’s prototype was a masterpiece crafted by a gunsmith. From hardwood selection to metalwork and a lightweight design, every choice strikes a lauded balance between utility and artistry. Each shot carries burning flames that scale with the wielder’s magical power. Uses standard ‖color:gui.yellow‖Shotgun Ammo‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Deceit: This weapon fires precision shots through twin penetrating rails, excelling at medium to long range and delivering devastating accuracy that leaves foes nowhere to hide. After activating its modification, melee attacks temporarily cause “Weak Point Exposure,” and Deceit deals 90% more damage to exposed targets. Ranged attacks have a 30% chance to expose weak points. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Rifle Ammo‖end‖. Modification energy is shown by remaining durability and must be full to activate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Aphelion: The aphelion is the point in an orbit farthest from the sun—just where you aim with this weapon. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Aphelion Energy Core‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Aphelion_Ammo: A dedicated energy core essential for firing the Aphelion, compressing unimaginable power into a tiny form. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Aphelion‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Three_Fairies_Triple_H: Even just three fairies can gather formidable power. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Arrows or the three “Ice-Melt Devices”‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Metal_Arr: Strange rays merge into a rainbow pattern in the air. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Three-Fairy Triple Heavy Crossbow‖end‖.
Strange rays merge into a rainbow pattern in the air. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Three-Fairy Triple Heavy Crossbow‖end‖.
Strange rays merge into a rainbow pattern in the air. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Three-Fairy Triple Heavy Crossbow‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Yukari_Folding_: A fan infused with the power of boundaries, capable of rapidly weakening enemy defenses as the borders shift. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Fan Mechanism‖end‖.
The intricate mechanism within the fan allows it to unleash danmaku despite its harmless appearance. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Yukari Yakumo’s Folding Fan‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Crystal_Pistol: Marisa collected crystals on Europa for a long time to craft this pistol. It fires crystalline star bullets with increased lethality against Europa’s natives. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Stellar Crystal‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Crystal_Pistol_: A carefully crafted crystal that reveals a faint starlight when observed closely. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Crystal Pistol‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Ceremonial_Dagg: A dagger used by Patchouli in ritual magic, imbued with elemental ritual power.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Veterinary_Stee: A pair of steel claws handmade by Reimu Hakurei for Aunn, capable of rending Europa’s dangerous creatures.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Maple_Leaf_Revo: A special revolver issued to the Tengu task force. Continuous firing greatly enhances its performance. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Revolver Bullets or Cyclone Bullets‖end‖.
A custom bullet developed from revolver rounds with the latest youkai mountain technology. It can also be used in standard revolvers. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Maple Leaf Revolver‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Stellar_Staff: A special staff developed by Europa’s magicians using precious data left by Patchouli before leaving the rocket research center. It can fire three different types of stellar projectiles.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sunflower_Headp: A carefully woven sunflower hair ornament exuding a mysterious, enchanting fragrance that clears the mind.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hakurei_Fox_Hea: A hairpin with a shrine fox motif, imbued with the unique aura of the Hakurei Shrine.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Royal_Diamond_R: A result of Patchouli’s magical synthesis experiments, capable of suppressing spell cards instantly. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Royal Diamond Fuel‖end‖.
A magical orb filled with highly dangerous magic energy, its internal power possesses considerable destructive force. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Royal Diamond Ring‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Plant_Machine: A planting cabinet specifically for cultivating magical materials, capable of growing certain magical plants.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Charge_Rifle: A high-energy assault rifle design from the so-called Shining World, firing charged rounds. Each bullet is infused with unstable energy upon leaving the barrel, greatly increasing damage. Requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Charge Relay and Battery (including Alien Battery)‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Charge_Rifle_Am: The critical component of the Charge Rifle, serving as the weapon’s operational core. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Charge Rifle‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dichromatic_Lot: A mysterious protective aura that resists external effects while amplifying the wearer’s buffs. Withstands water pressure damage and contains five magatama slots.\nLighting requires ‖color:gui.yellow‖Peaceful Magatama / Ancient Magatama – White‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Poison_Soaked_D: This dagger is absolutely coated in deadly poison~
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Gilding_Dagger: The gilding preserves not only memories, but also the future.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Black_Wings_Kni: A blade shaped like a black wing, effectively restricting the target’s movements.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_White_Wings_Kni: A blade shaped like a white wing, capable of inflicting painful burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Detoxificatioin: Removes toxins, especially those from unknown sources of contamination.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rose_Gift_Bag: To pursue the true meaning of a sweet holiday, Koishi wandered far and wide. Three auto-injection slots trigger at 15% health thresholds and can also keep the Unconscious Mousse effect active.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rose_Wand: The rose’s magic slowly blooms within… Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Undersea Rose‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rose_Wand_Ammo: An incredible magic allows this rose to bloom beneath the sea. Ammunition for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Rose Wand‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Ingredient_Refr: A cabinet for magically preserving food, protecting ingredients from heat and moisture.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cooktop01: The most basic cooktop, perfect for beginners.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cooktop02: A more refined cooktop with faster cooking speed and more convenient operation.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Food_Ingredient: Can be disassembled in the Deconstructor to obtain random seafood ingredients.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Trout: A cold-water freshwater fish, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lamprey: A migratory sea fish but found everywhere in Gensokyo’s rivers and lakes; quite common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Salmon: A highly migratory sea fish that can also be found in Gensokyo’s rivers and lakes; somewhat rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tuna: An oceanic migratory fish surprisingly found in Gensokyo’s rivers and lakes; somewhat rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Premium_Tuna: A top-grade variety of tuna, extremely valuable.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pufferfish: A high-end seafood delicacy, but its flesh contains toxins and must be handled with care.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Shrimp: Freshwater shrimp found in Misty Lake and Genbu Marsh; fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Octopus: A tender and charming marine creature—though Gensokyo has no sea. Its tentacles are a treasure, with an overwhelming meaty texture; a simple roast brings out a delicious springiness!
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sea_Urchin: Rumored to be a legendary delicacy in the outside world; just a small piece is said to convey the flavor of the entire ocean. Could it be true? It certainly looks quite strange…
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Crab: An eight-legged fool who thinks its shell is invincible—simple steaming turns it into ultimate deliciousness! But beware of the claws…
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Food_Ingredient: Can be disassembled in the Deconstructor to obtain random meats.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork: Meat from domesticated pigs in the Human Village, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Beef: Meat from domesticated cattle in the Human Village, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Venison: Deer meat hunted from the mountains; somewhat rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Boar_Meat: Wild boar meat hunted from the mountains, full of wild flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Iberico_Pork: Black-haired pork raised in high mountain altitudes; very premium.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Wagyu_Beef: Renowned as a top-quality beef breed, also called snowflake beef; extremely premium.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Food_Ingredient: Can be disassembled in the Deconstructor to obtain random vegetables.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tofu: Tofu sold in the Human Village; fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Potato: A common, ordinary potato found everywhere.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Onion: Onions grown in the Human Village’s fields; fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pumpkin: Pumpkins grown in the Human Village’s fields; fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Radish: Radishes grown in the Human Village’s fields; fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Seaweed: An imported ingredient of unknown origin, but quite common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mushroom: A high-quality mushroom gathered from the Forest of Magic, impossible to cultivate artificially, very precious.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Truffle: A fine truffle gathered from the Forest of Magic, impossible to cultivate artificially, very precious.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Bamboo_Shoot: Bamboo shoots gathered from the wild, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cucumber: A favorite of kappas. While it can be cooked like any ordinary vegetable, it’s irresistibly addictive to them—who knows what ingredient causes this effect…
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Chestnut: Legend says Taoist founders planted many chestnut trees as a staple food due to their vegetarian diet. The thick, nutritious kernels were cherished by Taoists and farmers alike as a grain substitute.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Red_Toon: A common wild vegetable. Slightly toxic; blanch before eating and avoid overconsumption.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tomato: A brightly colored berry once thought poisonous and called “Fox Fruit” for its vivid color, now widely cultivated after being found edible.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Broccoli: Broccoli cultivated in Makai’s soil; due to low light the plant is elongated and its florets differ slightly in color from the norm.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Food_Ingredient: Can be disassembled in the Deconstructor to obtain random miscellaneous foods.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Egg: Eggs supplied from the Human Village, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peach: Fruit of the peach tree, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Ginkgo_Nut: Fruit of the ginkgo tree, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Honey: Wild honey collected from tree hives, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cicada_Slough: Insect husks often found on tree trunks, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Udumbara: A miraculous flower that grows in swamps, extremely rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dew: Dew collected in the early morning; somewhat rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Butter: A common Western ingredient that easily adds irresistible fragrance to dishes.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Flour: Has many culinary uses, fairly common.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Bamboo: Freshly cut bamboo from the verdant Bamboo Forest of the Lost, exuding a crisp aroma.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sticky_Rice: Sticky rice that makes dishes either soft and smooth or pleasantly chewy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Herb: A specialty of Eientei, formed from moonlight on full-moon nights; extremely rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Ice_Cube: The solid form of water, keeps ingredients cool and is crystal clear.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Chili: An ingredient used to add spiciness; opinions on it are highly polarized.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Grape: Grapes cultivated at the Scarlet Devil Mansion for winemaking.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Black_Salt: Volcanic energy accumulated over millions of years; the advertisement claims it purifies the soul’s dust… but it’s essentially ordinary volcanic rock salt.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cream: Dairy processed in a special way, capable of captivating dessert lovers at any time!
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Bingdi_Lotus: Its rhizomes grow near bridges, with pale red flowers and a faint fragrance. A high-grade ingredient and a festival decoration for underground dwellers.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lemon: A peculiar fruit from special trees near bridges. Legend says no one can eat a whole one without wincing—its intense sourness makes it best used for juice and seasoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cheese: A precious food made by aging rich cream; a slice melted adds luscious dairy aroma and flavor to dishes.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lotus_Seed: The seed of the ancient aquatic lotus plant. The core is especially bitter—be sure to remove it before serving to guests.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sweet_Photo: The most dependable ingredient! Sweet, soft, and chewy, it powerfully relieves hunger and even keeps hands warm in winter.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pine_Nut: Seeds of the red pine tree, considered endangered outside Gensokyo but still common here. Legend says pine nuts prolong life and were a staple for ancient Taoists during fasting.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Plum: Fruit of the plum tree, can be salted or dried. Dried plums have a unique sweet-sour flavor that stimulates appetite and leaves a lingering pleasant aftertaste.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Red_Bean: Also known as adzuki beans, these hardy plants boost immunity and resistance to illness. Ancient lore says red beans ward off evil spirits responsible for strokes.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Flower: A bouquet of brilliant, vibrant flowers. Honor their sacrifice of life to bloom so beautifully!
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cocoa_Bean: The fruit of the cacao tree, said to vary in flavor by region—some fruity, some smoky. Ground into powder, it is the essential ingredient for chocolate.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Jiguru_Berry: A strange fruit found throughout Makai. It seems to produce different effects depending on who eats it—truly mysterious.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Creeping_Fig: A plant used for both medicine and food. Soaking the seeds and rubbing the juice produces a clear jelly when chilled, perfect for making jellies and cold desserts.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Snow_Fungus: A flower-like fungus long prized by royalty for longevity. In the Lunar Capital it is surprisingly common, its pure whiteness perfectly complementing the moon’s elegance.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Strong_Capsaici: A super-spicy product made with lunar technology, leaving terrifyingly hot memories. Who knows if it even contains real chili peppers…
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Seafood_Miso_So: A quick izakaya-style soup. When mysterious kelp first appeared in Gensokyo, someone boiled it out of curiosity and discovered an unexpected umami flavor, making this soup popular ever since.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Miso_Tofu: A quick izakaya-style soup. Uses tofu to enhance the flavor—a simple yet original taste.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Power_Soup: A delicious soup combining meat and vegetables. Made with boar meat and kelp to quickly replenish energy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork_Trout_Keba: Pork and trout smoked together—simple, tasty meat dish with good preservation.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Grilled_Lamprey: House specialty. To break the stereotype that red-lantern shops only grill chicken, lamprey—known for helping night blindness and once considered a treasure—was chosen.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Energy_Skewer: Beef skewers with onion and pumpkin. The onion’s bite and pumpkin’s sweetness remove the meat’s greasiness for a refreshing taste.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Niten_Ichiryu: A legendary grilling style created by a human swordsman who once bested an oni. Uses wild meats for a bold, sky-reaching flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rice_Ball: The most basic rice ball. Add a bit of kelp and shape it casually for a classic, super-convenient snack.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork_Rice_Ball: A common, affordable rice ball stuffed with roasted pork for rich, chewy flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pink_Rice_Ball: A common rice ball with trout and onion filling, blending seafood delicacy with onion heat for top-notch nutrition and taste.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Falling_Blossom: A type of premium sushi. Pink premium sashimi over white rice looks like cherry blossoms falling on snow—wonderfully beautiful.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork_Stir_Fry: A home-style dish with pork as the main ingredient; boldly flavored.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fresh_Tofu: A refreshing summer side dish perfect with drinks, simple and crisp.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Kabayaki_Lampre: House specialty. Eel grilled with a special sauce until juicy and fragrant, tempting with every whiff.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Potato_Croquett: Crispy outside, soft inside—these potato-based fried treats are very popular.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hunter_S_Casser: A farmhouse stew of vegetables and premium black-haired pork. Rich and hearty yet not greasy, a pinnacle of rural cuisine.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork_Bowl: A common home-style meal of plump rice topped with savory pork and sauce that whets the appetite.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Beef_Bowl: A common home-style meal of plump rice topped with savory beef and sauce for a satisfying flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fried_Lampreys: House specialty. These odd-looking lampreys once became a fad among adventurous diners in Gensokyo. Deep-fried for a tender, crispy delight.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Vegetable_Salad: A salad of fresh raw vegetables. Refreshing and oil-cleansing, adored by young women as the ultimate diet dish.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Shirayuki: A premium hot pot of lamprey and pufferfish simmered with kelp. Named for the pure white foam that rises during cooking—a top-tier home dish.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tofu_Stew: A hotpot made with tofu. Smooth texture and high nutrition make it an izakaya staple.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hodgepodge: A stew of assorted leftovers. Enjoy great taste while preventing waste—two birds with one stone.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sashimi_Platter: A showcase of Japanese cuisine, featuring sashimi-grade salmon and tuna with wasabi and soy to highlight their freshness.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Daimyo_S_Feast: A luxurious hotpot of premium ingredients. Expert heat control extracts the best from each component for tender, juicy, richly flavored results.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tonkotsu_Ramen: Pork bones and vegetables simmered long into a rich broth—the soul of the bowl. The creamy broth and springy noodles satisfy completely.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fuji_S_Lava: A hotpot of premium beef and truffle, originally spicy and named for its bubbling, lava-like surface. Now also available in a milder version.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fried_Cicada_Sl: Molted cicada shells, used medicinally for throat and eye health, deep-fried for a crisp texture that’s surprisingly popular.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dew_Runny_Eggs: Eggs boiled with fresh morning dew for a hint of sweetness. Lightly cooked for a runny yolk that almost spills when touched.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Udumbara_Cake: A pastry made with the ancient miraculous Udumbara flower. Sweet but not cloying, it leaves a lasting fragrance and is said to stir cherished memories.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Imitatiion_Bear: The pinnacle of odd delicacies! Its aroma travels far and wide. Unable to hunt real bears, cooks created a version even tastier than the real thing.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Secret_Dried_Fi: Small fish marinated with special spices then sun-dried. Crispy, tasty, and easy to store—every household keeps some.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Carved_Rose_Sal: Fresh fruits and vegetables carved into roses. Simple ingredients but demands excellent knife skills.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peach_Tapioca: A heavenly recipe using fresh peach blossoms and morning dew. Fragrant and sweet, with rumored healing and beauty benefits.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peach_Shrimp_Sa: A premium dish of the finest shrimp and peaches, said to appear only at grand banquets in the outside world.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Deep_Fried_Tofu: A common home dish and rumored favorite of Inari’s fox messengers.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scholar_S_Ginkg: Named after the ginkgo tree before the Confucius Temple’s “Shili Hall,” fragrant, sweet, and chewy. Said to relieve intoxication and cough.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Real_Seafood_Mi: A miso soup simmered with fresh trout and kelp. Rich umami aroma, fresh but not fishy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Roasted_Mushroo: Mushrooms skewered, lightly oiled, grilled, and sprinkled with coarse salt—flavor as good as meat!
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Boiled_Tofu: A common home dish where careful simmering brings out tofu’s delicate flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fried_Pork_Cutl: A popular home dish: pork coated in flour and deep-fried—kids from next door will come begging.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Classic_Steak: A simple yet nuanced Western classic. Doneness and ingredients change its character; rumor says the Scarlet Devil Mansion’s mistress prefers medium rare.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Italian_Risotto: A recipe from an overseas peninsula: sauté ingredients then add raw rice so every grain absorbs the flavors.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Beef_Wellington: Beef and truffle wrapped in buttery puff pastry and baked—a complex, exquisite dish famous for its difficulty.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Eggs_Benedict: Poached eggs with flowing yolk atop hearty carbs—an iconic brunch choice.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pancakes_With_S: A simple breakfast: fry the prepared batter and drizzle with honey.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scones: A staple of English afternoon tea, crisp outside and soft within, typically served with jam or cream.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Salmon_Steak: Skin-on salmon seared to crispy perfection, served with tender bamboo shoots—outside this recipe usually uses asparagus, making it a Gensokyo fusion dish.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Creamy_Vegetabl: A home-style creamy soup. Simple to make and great with bread or as a stew.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cantonese_Char_: A special recipe from Hong Meiling’s hometown. Though a bit complex to prepare, its unique flavor is unforgettable.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Golden_Ribs_Sou: A hearty soup from Hong Meiling’s hometown, fragrant and flavorful, said to replenish energy and nourish the blood.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Kaguya_Hime: A specialty of Eientei. Fresh ingredients and rice are steamed inside bamboo, infusing the rice with bamboo aroma that balances the richness of wild boar meat.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Immortal_Turkey: Flour is baked into the shape of a roast turkey, brushed with honey and filled with assorted ingredients. The result is a faux roast with crisp skin and juicy stuffing.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Dango: A specialty mochi from Eientei, enhanced with the premium Moonlight Herb. Cute in shape and said to have a “moonlight-like texture.”
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mochi: The most common chewy rice dumpling and a beloved traditional sweet.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Peach_Yatsuhash: A classic wagashi shaped like an ancient koto. Filled with white peach paste for a soft pink, irresistible treat.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Lunar_Lover_Bis: Outside the barrier, regional souvenirs often carry names like “○○ Lover.” Eientei follows the trend with its own sweet version!
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Ino_Shika_Chou: Inspired by the hanafuda card set “Ino-Shika-Chou,” this refined dish simmers pork and venison with flowers to draw out their natural flavors.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Flowing_Somen: Less about taste and more about the fun of catching noodles flowing in cold water.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pork_Bamboo_Sho: The simplest bamboo shoot dish, with pork’s savory oils highlighting the shoots’ freshness.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Steamed_Egg_Bam: Chawanmushi-style egg custard steamed in a bamboo container for a distinctive aroma.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Hourai_Branch: Simply assorted premium meats skewered for a single satisfying bite—elevated to a signature delicacy under Lady Kaguya’s insistence.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Stinky_Tofu: A rare black tofu with a pungent aroma that challenges diners—but once tasted, it’s impossible to stop eating.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Rainbow_Pan_Fri: Premium pan-fried buns radiating seven-colored energy. Purists debate the inclusion of ingredients beyond pork.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mapo_Tofu: A famous Chinese dish in Japan. Spicy tofu cooked with unique techniques, addictive when eaten over rice.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sichuan_Boiled_: Authentic Sichuan cuisine: tender fish simmered with fiery red chili peppers for an aromatic, spicy delight.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Moon_Cake: Known for its festive symbolism and round shape. With many flavors, it remains a perennial topic of conversation.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cubic_Kedama_Ic: Square, tri-colored “Kedama” ice cream. Its charming colors and flavors make it a signature treat everyone wants.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Cubic_Kedama_Vo: Square “volcanic” Kedama tofu, fiery in appearance and beloved by those seeking a tongue-tingling thrill.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scarlet_Devil_C: A dreamy dessert modeled after the Scarlet Devil’s hat, filled with a sweet sauce reminiscent of crimson blood.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Unconscious_Yok: A deep, dark dessert shaped after the Unconscious Yokai’s hat. Cut it open to reveal rich darkness and captivating flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dumplings: A famous recipe from Hong Meiling’s homeland. Dough wrapped around any desired filling and boiled for a simple yet treasure-filled meal.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tangyuan: Another classic from Hong Meiling’s homeland. Sweet glutinous rice balls with various fillings, boiled for a tender, delightful dessert.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Deep_Fried_Shri: Fresh shrimp coated in batter and deep-fried until golden and crisp—neighbors’ children will cry for a taste.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Golden_Crispy_F: Fish patties mixed with a touch of honey, pressed and fried to golden perfection. Best eaten straight from the fryer.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_All_Meat_Feast: A mountain of assorted premium grilled meats. Visually impressive and overwhelmingly satisfying for keen-nosed carnivores.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pickles: Cucumber pieces brined with salt and seasoning for an irresistibly savory flavor.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Creamy_Crab: Before the lid is lifted, the aroma of creamy baked crab fills the air. Crack the claws for plump, tender meat and savor the rich broth for the true crab essence.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Imitation_Shiri: Legend says the shirikodama is a remnant tailbone prized by kappa. Once taken violently from humans, it is now recreated as a costly delicacy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Okonomiyaki: A popular street snack from the outside world: a savory pancake of batter mixed with various ingredients and grilled to crispy, rich perfection, loved for its versatility and affordability.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Green_Tea: The most ordinary beverage, prepared for timid youkai who can’t handle even a drop of alcohol.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fruity_Highball: A common izakaya cocktail of whiskey, fruit juice, and soda. Lower alcohol content makes it enjoyable for anyone.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Fruity_Sour: A typical izakaya drink made with shochu, fruit juice, and soda—offering a more distinctly Japanese flavor than the Fruity Highball.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mio: This lightly sparkling sake with added soda has a sweet-tart taste and low alcohol content, making it especially popular with women—like a champagne version of sake.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_ZUN_Beer: A side project from a certain figure closely tied to Gensokyo. Though brewed as a hobby, it became surprisingly popular.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sangetsusei: A junmai sake blessed by fairies. Low in alcohol, smooth in taste, and an izakaya favorite at a friendly price.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Umeshu: Homemade plum wine from the Human Village. Its sweetness often catches the unwary off guard with a strong aftereffect.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Tengu_Tango: A delicious sake so good that even tengu are said to dance with joy. Unlike other clear sakes, it has a faint amber hue.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Bloody_Remy: A mix of vodka, tomato juice, lemon, and celery root, blending sweet, sour, bitter, and spicy flavors. Its blood-red color recalls a certain vampire mistress.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Divine_Wheat: Barley shochu brewed from grains blessed by the autumn gods of Youkai Mountain.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Dassai: A trophy of the Oni Hero Group. Named after the way otter spirits arranged their spoils like a festival, it’s actually a premium junmai daiginjo sake.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Akatsuki: A whiskey refined to suit Gensokyo tastes, retaining its characteristic aroma while offering a smooth, mellow finish.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sparrow_Sake: Legend says sparrows brew this sake by storing rice in cut bamboo where water collects, eventually fermenting into a fine liquor. Drinkers are said to dance endlessly—a “cursed” delight.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Scarlet_Tea: A black tea blend of lemon, bergamot, and the head maid’s carefully selected leaves, named plainly after the Scarlet Devil Mansion to expand its renown.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Godsplitter: This finely balanced weapon is the product of advanced metallurgy.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Living_Cleaver: Its core burns with a living flame and shines brilliantly. Evolve it by slaying 66 creatures outside the submarine. Progress resets if the player dies.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Sentient_Greatc: Silently, the Living Cleaver has awakened and evolved. ‖color:gui.red‖Deliver a fatal slash to your enemy.‖end‖
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Charging_: Can recharge most magic weapon ammunition (excluding those requiring the Astral layer).
Can recharge all magic weapon ammunition (excluding those requiring the Astral layer).
Can recharge all magic weapon ammunition and is more durable.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Phoenix_Tail_Ta: Welding fuel refined from phoenix feathers that slowly regenerates its own durability until exhausted.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Merry_MobilePho: A phone Merry once used to contact the outside world. Using it grants random nearby crew members a buff.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Ray_Gun: A creation born from interpreting the Philosopher’s Stone, capable of firing magic-infused rays. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Shining Cube‖end‖ as ammo.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Magic_Ray_Gun_A: A cube brimming with magical energy that fires intense magic beams. Said to be inspired by an earthly puzzle toy. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Magic Ray Gun‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mercy: A glimpse of Moon Capital technology. A painless death is the predator’s final mercy to its prey. Compatible with the ‖color:gui.yellow‖White Falcon‖end‖ series attachments. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Blunderbuss ammo or Mercy Magazine‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mercy_Ammo: Contains 10 high-powered rounds, said to be made from lunar meteorites. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Mercy‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mercy_Barrel: For Mercy, reduces noise to avoid unwanted attention. Silent dive… eternal stillness…
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Mercy_Sight: For Mercy, strikes enemy weak points with precision. Reveal truth with dark vision; seize glory with razor talons.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Yin_Yang_Scatte: A spell card that fires multiple small Yin-Yang orbs, suppressing groups of youkai.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pellen_Gun: Originally Yuuka’s watering can for sunflowers, modified on Europa into a deadly weapon. Uses ‖color:gui.yellow‖Pollen Canister‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Pellen_Bottle: A jar of specially blended pollen that, when sprayed, is surprisingly lethal. Ammo for ‖color:gui.yellow‖Pollen Sprayer‖end‖ (‖color:gui.yellow‖cannot be recharged‖end‖).
infotexts.entitydescription.Touhou_Repair_Gun: Uses element magic to remove external damage from a target.
